channel.title: Steam for iOS and Android
channel.description:
[img]https://cdn.store.steampowered.com/public/images/mobile/SM_Devices.png[/img]
The app is there. But it's a closed beta at the moment. It's available for iPhone 3GS, iPhone 4, iPhone 4S, iPod touch 3rd and 4th generation and iPad with iOS 4.0 or higher and for all android versions as it seems.
[url]https://store.steampowered.com/mobile[/url]
[url]https://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2012/01/26/steam-mobile-app-launches.aspx[/url] [quote] If you want to join the beta, simply download the free app and sign into your Steam account. Users will be added to the closed beta as the service ramps up, Valve said. [/quote]

item.title: Steam for iOS and Android
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Awesomeness!:

you’ll have to wait years before being able to play games like hl2 on your phone lol

In a way not really. Smart phones are progressing VERY quickly and some games like shadowgun far surpass HL2 already. Admittedly they’re made from the ground up, but I think smartphones have the potential, it’s just up to valve to put in the porting work. Sadly controls for 3d games on smartphones suck ass so if they did do the work it probably wouldn’t be too fun.

item.description:
BahamutBBob:

Being able to use Steam chat on the go could be nice, but I doubt it’d be very effective otherwise.

Sitting on the bus/in traffic/etc. “Oops, I forgot to buy insert game here I should do that right now!” Not much point unless they let you start the download on the computer that you have idling with Steam running.

That would be useful.
